Tag 1: on site qa

Name: 1 - Description of General Condition (100% of structure)
Tag 1: 1 - description of general condition (100% of structure)

Name: 1.1 - Are there any out of plane displacement of overhead structure element/s
Tag 1: 1.1 - are there any out of plane displacement of overhead structure element/s.

Name: 1.2 - Obvious visible signs of distress including, but not limited to failure, leaks, corrosion, cracking & spalling
Tag 1: 1.2 - obvious visible signs of distress including, but not limited to failure, leaks, corrosion, cracking and spalling.

Name: 1.3 - Take photos of general conditon of structure & include any items identified above
Tag 1: 1.3 - take photos of general conditon of structure and include any items identified above.

Name: 2 - Detailed Inspection (25% of structure)
Tag 1: 2 - detailed inspection (25% of structure)

Name: 2.1 - Are there horizontal surfaces where water can pond from above
Tag 1: 2.1 - are there horizontal surfaces where water can pond from above.

Name: 2.2 - Inspect condition of connections
Tag 1: 2.2 - inspect condition of connections to check if bolts / screws appear to be visibly tight and if connection shows any signs of distress.

Name: 2.3 - Can you identify what the connection is?
Tag 1: 2.3 - can you identify what the connection is? galvanised / stainless / zinc __ bolt gauge m16 /m12 / m10 / m8 __ screw gauge 8ga / 10ga / 12/ga / 14ga. identify the edge distances and fixing centres

Name: 2.4 - Are there out-of-plane displacements of overhead structure elements
Tag 1: 2.4 - are there any out-of-plane displacements of overhead structure elements while scanning vertically and horizontally.

Name: 2.5 - Are there signs of staining, concrete spalling & cracking, water/moisture damage, weathering or distress
Tag 1: 2.5 - are there any signs of staining, concrete spalling and cracking, water/moisture damage, weathering or distress of overhead componets

Name: 2.6 - Sounding the surface (i.e. tapping) with a hammer if material delamination of overhead structure is possible
Tag 1: 2.6 - sounding the surface (i.e. tapping) with a hammer if material delamination of overhead structure is possible.

Name: 2.7 - Push against & pull on the overhead structure element
Tag 1: 2.7 - push against and pull on the overhead structure element to check for unexpected movement or deformation to identify failed or loose compents of the overhead structure

Name: 2.8 - Pull test on adhesively attached components of the overhead structure
Tag 1: 2.8 - pull test on adhesively attached components of the overhead structure.

Name: 2.9 - Evaluate sealant adhesion with pull & peel testing in locations
Tag 1: 2.9 - evaluate sealant adhesion with pull and peel testing in locations.

Name: 3 - Removal of loose or fractured components of overhead structure to reveal cause of distress
Tag 1: 3 - removal of loose or fractured components of overhead structure to reveal cause of distress, where safe to do so.

Name: Temporary rectification may be required
Tag 1: temporary rectification may be required.

Name: 3.1 - Cursory/visual leak survey of external element, in particular noting any signs of previous water ingress & its potential sources
Tag 1: 3.1 - cursory / visual leak survey of external element, in particular noting any signs of previous water ingress and its potential sources.

Name: 4 - Condition Observation Summary
Tag 1: 4 - condition observation summary
